Key Match Events: The Suns struggled with field goal percentage and three-point shooting, missing 14 of 14 three-point attempts in the first quarter.
The Suns took their first lead of the night after opening the third quarter on a 10-3 run, but the Kings responded effectively.
Post-Match Reflections: DeMar DeRozan was forced out of action early and did not return.
The Suns are at Oklahoma City on Friday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings shot an amazing 63% from the field in the first two quarters while Phoenix outrebounded them 28-19.
The game's progression included the Suns' early struggles, a comeback in the second quarter, but eventually falling short in the fourth quarter.
